intro: Cardiospermum corindum f. subsetulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heartseed. It is a variant of the heartseed plant, characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and distinctive heart-shaped seed pods. The plant belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is native to tropical regions of Asia. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, and the plant thrives in moist, shady environments.
